intro: Haloragis myriocarpa, commonly known as the many-fruited willow herb, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wetland or swampy environments. The plant features slender, often prostrate stems that produce small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters. Its leaves are narrow and opposite, and it is known for its prolific production of small, capsule-like fruits. Haloragis myriocarpa plays an important role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various insects and small animals.
